user_auth.models module

class user_auth.models.User(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a user in the application.

Fields:

username (str): The username of the user (max length: 50 characters). password (str): The password of the user (max length: 128 characters). email (str): The email address of the user (max length: 254 characters, unique).

__str__()[source]

Returns a string representation of the user, which is their username.

id

The unique identifier of the user, automatically generated by Django.

Type:

int

Note: Storing passwords as plain text is not recommended for security reasons. Consider using a secure password hashing library like Argon2 or bcrypt to store hashed passwords.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user_auth.views module

user_auth.views.authenticate_user(request)[source]

Authenticates a user’s login credentials and logs them in if valid.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect to the user’s profile page on successful login, or to the login page if authentication fails.

user_auth.views.registration(request)[source]

Handles user registration by rendering the registration form and processing form submissions.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

An HTTP redirect to the login page after successful user registration.

user_auth.views.show_user(request)[source]

Renders a view to display the user’s username and password.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A rendered HTML page displaying the user’s username and password.

user_auth.views.user_login(request)[source]

Renders a view for the user login page.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

A rendered HTML page for user login.
